titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lillian A. de Severinus collection 1973.262
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-08T15:03-0500

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Lillian A. de Severinus collection, 1973.262, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Lillian A. de Severinus was an artist and the head of the De Severinus Art School (also known as the De Severinus Academy of Fine and Applied Art) in Brooklyn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains various materials spanning the period 1898 to 1941 and relating to Brooklyn-based artist Lillian A. de Severinus, the De Severinus Art School, and art in Brooklyn. Items include two scrapbooks of clippings and photographs, as well as loose pamphlets, photographs, programs, trade and exhibition cards, and one page of a diary.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. A.V. Du Pell, 1962.
